Title: Error_ _Timeout expired_ _ Community
Author: Christian Hauggaard
Text: You receive an error similar to the following: Timeout expired. The timeout period elapsed prior to completion of the operation or the server is not responding. Error during Data Processing for Table: <TABLENAME> Timeout expired. The timeout period elapsed prior to completion of the operation or the server is not responding. Stored Procedure: [dbo].[usp_XXXXXX_Clean] Parameters: @Debug = 0 @Version = 182 @LoadDate = 09-01-2012 16:59:06 If you do not change the default timeout settings, any query on a DW instance will timeout after 100 seconds. To change the timeout setting and solve the described timeout problem do the following on the DW instance in question:

Lists.heading: Resolution
paragraphs: To change the timeout setting and solve the described timeout problem do the following on the DW instance in question:
list: Select Edit for the DW instance in the TimeXtender Portal
Set the Command Timeout to a higher value (e.g. 3600 for a one hour timeout)
